text: The wise who knows the Self as bodiless within the bodies, as unchanging among changing things, as great and omnipresent, does never grieve.
Truth is one; sages call it by various names.
A person can achieve everything by being simple and humble.
Ego is the biggest enemy of humans.
You have the right to work, but never to the fruit of work. You should never engage in action for the sake of reward, nor should you long for inaction.
The mind is restless and difficult to restrain, but it is subdued by practice.
I am the same to all beings. I favor none and reject none. But those who worship Me with devotion, they live in Me, and I in them.
When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
One who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is intelligent among men.
The one who loves all intensely begins perceiving in all living beings a part of himself.
